results.title: Broadway melody of 1938
results.creator_credit: Roy Del Ruth, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Taylor plays Steve Raleigh, a Broadway producer who wants to put on a show called Broadway Melody. Eleanor Powell plays Sally Lee, the girl Steve loves who owns a racehorse which must win the big event to finance the show. Sensational dancing is the highlight of this musical as well as Judy Garland’s very first appearance in an MGM musical performing her first big hit - ‘Dear Mr. Gable (You Made Me Love You)’ - a superb show-stopper.

results.title: The Virgin queen
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Charles Brackett and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Bette Davis gives her second memorable performance as Queen Elizabeth I in this swashbuckling historical drama that also features Joan Collins in an early screen performance. It is the story of the aging queen’s attraction to handsome Sir Walter Raleigh (Richard Todd) and her bitter clash with a scheming, younger rival (Collins). Rich in historical detail, lavish with authentic cotumes and period decor and enlivened by thrilling swordplay, “The Virgin Queen” is a legendary re-creation of one of England’s most fascinating eras, made all the more alluring by Davis’ dynamic performance.

results.title: Moon over Miami
results.creator_credit: Walter Lang, Harry Joe Brown and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When two sisters (played by Betty Grable and Carole Landis) fail to receive an expected inheritance, they decide to pool their resources with their Aunt and head for Florida, posing as an heiress, a secretary and a maid in the hopes of ensnaring a couple of millionaires. Grable is soon involved with two, Don Ameche and Robert Cummings, but all is not what it seems. Ameche is just as broke as the girls, but woos gold-digger Grable with his smooth talk and charming ways, with genuine millionaire Cummings in hot pursuit. A bright and breezy song-filled musical, as Grable turns in some fine dance routines with the Condos Brothers. Fabulous comic performances from the cast help make this film one of the best Hollywood musicals of its era.

results.title: Cooee
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Geoffrey Barnes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In 1915, the Australian Land Army marched on the Cooee trail from the mid-western farming town of Gilgandra to Sydney, gathering volunteer troops for the Dardanelles on the way. In 1987, a new band of “Cooees” set off to re-enact the march. The film’s production crew were involved from the march’s planning stage. This record of the re-enactment covering the 550 km from Gilgandra to the Sydney Town Hall not only provides a portrait of the individuals involved but also gives a glimpse of the mood and attitudes of rural Australia, 1987.

results.title: The Pawnbroker
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Phillip Langner, Roger Lewis and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A powerful drama that focuses on Sol Nazerman (Rod Steiger), a middle-aged concentration camp survivor who lost his entire family to the Nazis and now runs a pawnshop in Harlem. His survival is a source of bewilderment and pain which has caused him to take refuge in misery and the condemnation of humanity. He is totally removed from the world of thieves and pimps that frequent his shop and displays no emotional vulnerability to the few people who try to penetrate his icy exterior. When his assistant Ortiz (Jaime Sanchez) sacrifices his own life for Sol during a robbery, the pawnbroker is finally confronted with the inherent goodness of the human spirit. Attacked at the time of its release for being anti-Semitic, anti-Black and pornographic, the film is also memorable for its innovative use of flashbacks to represent the disturbing flashes of Sol’s memory and the soundtrack composed by Quincy Jones. Also stars Geraldine Fitzgerald. Based on the novel by Edward Lewis Wallant.

results.title: The Son of the sheik
results.creator_credit: George Fitzmaurice, J Schneck and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Valentino in his greatest role as the notorious shiek, the defiant and romantic heroic figure of the Arabian desert. This is the classic tale of the English-born but desert-bred Shiek, who fired by the love of a French dancing girl, risks all in his quest to possess her. The torrid sequence of the shiek and his Yasmine, now kidnapped and isolated in his tent, remains a landmark portrayal of sensual desire. A special bonus at the end includes highlights from Valentino’s career and the mass hysteria captured on film when Valentino died.

results.title: Under the volcano
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Wieland Schulz-Keil, Moritz Borman and Ithaca-Conacine
results.brief_description: Albert Finney and Jacqueline Bisset combine to bring Malcolm Lowry’s powerful, critically acclaimed novel to the screen with all its imagery, symbolism, insight and passion. A despairing alcoholic British ex-consul in a small Mexican town goes on a drunken odyssey on the local day of the dead. During the intense dramatic twenty four hours he is distracted but not really diverted from his downward descent into damnation. The vivid brutal action is shocking and the tragic self absorption haunting. Also stars Anthony Andrews.

results.title: La Balance (S)
results.creator_credit: Bob Swaim, Films A2 and Les Film Ariane
results.brief_description: Heightened crime and increased prosititution in the streets of Paris, force the criminal investigation department to set up a special unit of police called the Territorial Brigades. Their only hope of penetrating the French Maffia is through a network of informers but the perfect informer is killed and another must be found from the pimps and prostitutes of the French underground. Voted the best film of the year in France at the time of its release, La Balance is a world of violence where only the tough survive. This version is dubbed in English.

results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Sandra Gross, Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: Murder she said
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, George H. Brown and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “4.50 from Paddington” by Agatha Christie also published as “What Mrs McGillicuddy Saw!” Dozing in her seat as the train leaves Paddington Station, Miss Jane Marple awakens to witness a strangulation aboard a passing train. The police do not believe her but undaunted, Miss Marple takes a job as a domestic in an attempt to discover the truth. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Arthur Kennedy, Muriel Pavlow and James Robertson Justice.
